data.title: Comfortable and affordable
data.text: Was in Anchorage for business, so I stayed here with others on my team who had previously stayed here. Though the hotel felt a little rustic, it was very comfortable and convenient. The shops and food options in the hotel were a great addition that catered to coming home from work and not needing to make further dinner/drink plans. We got the government rate, but regular rates seemed reasonable. I would definitely stay here again.

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Hotel Captain Cook, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Richard B,

Thank you for staying at the Hotel Captain Cook. It's great to hear that we came recommended to you and that it was an enjoyable stay. For our business travelers, we know that ease and comfort are the top priority. We're glad you found these qualities at our property and we hope to see you on your next trip.

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very central!
data.text: My husband and I stayed here post cruise for 4 days. Beautiful hotel, lots of Captain Cook paintings etc as the hotel is obviously named for him and there is a lovely bronze sculpture outside which depicts his 3 voyages! The hotel has great restaurants, shops, is in a very central position and easy to get around Anchorage from here. Close to the harbour also and not far from train station.

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Hotel Captain Cook, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Margot E,

Thank you for staying with us at the Hotel Captain Cook. We appreciate you taking the time to let others know what you love about our property. We're so glad you enjoyed our decor and the many shopping and dining outlets we host. Our downtown location does make it so easy to sightsee and enjoy everything Anchorage has to offer. We hope you'll return to Alaska for another memorable trip!

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great location, dated interior, but serves purpose
data.text: We stayed a couple nights at the Captain Cook while on the land portion of our Princess Sea & Land vacation. While clean, the hotel seems very dark and dated. I honestly felt like I was stepping back in time upon entering the hotel. Its a long walk between towers, so be prepared. The central location makes for a short walk to several very good downtown eateries. The room served its purpose, offering a decent night's rest, but it was nothing special. They have good "black out curtains", which is a real plus for the summer when the sun is up almost all night. I personally think the hotel is need of a major renovation, but it is fine for a couple nights.

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Hotel Captain Cook, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Ken T,

Thank you for staying at the Hotel Captain Cook. We always appreciate it when our Princess Cruise Line Guests take the time to provide feedback about their stay. We're happy to hear that you enjoyed our close proximity to great downtown restaurants and that you were able to relax in our accommodations. Our property has a historic ambience with dark wood and stone walls throughout the lobby to match the art and displays related to Captain Cook's expeditions. We hope you'll return to the Land of the Midnight Sun for another adventure!

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Beautiful views, but outdated rooms.
data.text:
I've been in AK for 3 weeks for work and decided to move to this hotel and give it a try. I read on their website that floors 16 and 17 had access to the captain's deck with the amenities I was looking for. I checked in no problem at the government rate and requested the 17th floor. They granted my request and I went up to my room. The views were beautiful even though the weather was bad. I later found out that the captain's deck was only on the other tower. I also found out later that they only offer valet parking at $30 a day. Luckily I was able to find street parking several times and only had to pay the meter between 9am-6pm. The bathroom had no exhaust fan, one of the lamps in the room had no on button and the shower handle fell off on me while trying to adjust the water. I could believe that this was once a top of the line hotel, but it's showing its age and is due for a makeover. There are better options in the area.

The staff was very friendly and the food we had at two of their restaurants was good.

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Hotel Captain Cook, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Dave S,

Thank you for staying with us at the Captain Cook. We appreciate you taking the time to tell others about your stay. You are correct that the Captain's Deck is the 16th and 17th floors of specifically Tower 2. These rooms and amenities are available upon request at a separate rate. I'm sorry to hear that there were some issues in the room. We are always happy to send an onsite engineer if anything needs attention. I'm glad that you found the staff to be attentive and our dining enjoyable. I hope you'll return to Anchorage for a more enjoyable stay in the future. 

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Beautiful, clean, location great & restaurants wonderful.
data.text: Stayed 2 nights at beginning of land/cruise trip & was very happy with this hotel. Highly recommend it! View was awesome. Room was very nice, comfortable & spotless. Walking distance to great restaurants & stores.

Louisa, Concierge

data.text: I came to the captain cook for the Alaska Salsa Festival and the staff was very nice and helpful when I was looking for the Ballroom. I've enjoyed myself so much while I was there, the dancing, the food, and the service, I can't wait to go back!

The beds are comfy and the service is all class. Even the bathroom on top floor of Crows Nest is all class!!! 😃

data.title: Birthday celebration
data.text: Excellent hotel that lives up to its reputation. We had dinner at the hotel pub, Fletchers, and the meal, service and price were very good. We also ate breakfast at hotel cafe, Cubbies, and again enjoyed outstanding service and meal.

data.title: Great hotel
data.text: Clean and upscale. The view is spectacular from most rooms but especially on the water side. Comfy beds with good linens. Nice little tray of chocolates and pistacios delivered to our room, nice!  Three great restaurants to choose from.. Highly recommend the Crows Nest. On the 20th floor, spectacular sunset! Menu to match!

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Hotel Captain Cook, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

We're happy to hear that you enjoyed our comfortable accommodations, dining options, and beautiful views. We hope to see you again in Anchorage for another wonderful stay!

owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great bed
data.text: This is a beautiful hotel in the heart of downtown Anchorage. There are three places to eat in the hotel and two excellent bars. The food is exceptional and the variety of drinks is impressive. Rooms have one king bed or two queens with a small frig, Keurig coffee machine and flat screen TV. There are two art galleries, one clothing store, a Pategonia store, a gift shop, and a high end dog accessories store on the ground floor of the hotel. There is a day spa and fitness center with sauna as well. The conference facilities are comfortable and the staff overall was top notch. Shopping and sight seeing are within walking distance. The only negative I can think of is there is no shuttle. That means a $20 cab ride if you are only staying there for business like I was. Overall this is an excellent hotel.

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Hotel Captain Cook, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Tina C,

Thank you for staying with us at the Captain Cook. We appreciate you providing this detailed review of our property. It sounds like our accommodations, amenities, shopping and dining all made for a great stay during your conference. We host many group meetings and conferences and our staff is here to help with anything these groups may need. We hope you'll return to Anchorage and stay with us again!

Louisa, Concierge

Fun Fact: Alaska's coastline extends over 6,000 miles.

data.title: Crows Bar
data.text:
Please visit this top of the Cook Hotel upscale bar and restaurant with amazing food drinks wine service and views!!!

I've been coming here for dinner since 2011. Always a fantastic experience! 

Two sides for views water or mountains. You pick

data.title: Grand old classy modernized hotel! Our favorite in Anchorage!!
data.text:
We have stayed here numerous times and still love this place!! Staff are wonderful; several different restaurant and pub/wine options; nice variety of shops on main level; rooms are well done and classy. The rooms have a Keurig, safe nice TV, free wifi throughout hotel, ceiling fans (no air conditioning). We have stayed in large corner suites, deluxe rooms, and even the largest suites on the top floor. LOVE THEM! This is a wonderful locally owned hotel.

The Crow's Nest Restaurant at the top of the hotel is very good and a deluxe place to go. Great views!! All restaurants and pub are very good!! Locals love this place!!

We look forward to hosting you again soon!

Louisa, Concierge

data.title: Great hotel, outstanding staff!
data.text: After a 30 hour trip from Australia, we arrived at The Hotel Captain Cook and were greeted by friendly and professional staff who made us feel very welcome and even acknowledged that we were staying for our 20th anniversary.  It was such a great first impression of the hotel and a fantastic start to our once in a lifetime trip to Alaska.  Our room was well appointed, had a fantastic view overlooking the inlet and a super comfy bed.  Breakfast was fantastic, the location was great and the hotel had great facilities.  Thank you for making our stay extra special, we can't tell you how much it was appreciated!

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Hotel Captain Cook, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Anthea_80,

Thank you for choosing to stay at the Hotel Captain Cook. We appreciate the time you've taken to recommend us to others. We love to provide guests with a comfortable and welcoming experience--especially since it's sometimes a far journey to get here! We're so happy that you chose to celebrate such a big milestone with us. It sounds like the beautiful view and accommodations made it a memorable trip!

Louisa, Concierge

Fun Fact: The Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race is a famous 1,000 mile (1,609 km) race from Anchorage to Nome each February. The Iditarod record was set in 2011 by John Quniaq Baker (also the first Native Inupiaq to win the race) in a time of 8 days, 19 hours, 46 minutes, and 39 seconds.

data.title: Ask for the view of the Inlet
data.text: Stayed at the Captain Cook Hotel for a conference. The services were excellent. The people who work their were kind and the conference food was actually good! They weren't sure what Vegan was but were happy to make it happen. The room we were in was small but had everything we needed plus a view of the Inlet/ocean. With the full moon that night it was perfect. The shops in the lobby were first class. I couldn't afford most ideas but it was so much fun looking. There's even a chocolate shop. We are going back and stay for a weekend just for fun and to go shopping and dining around Anchorage.

We're happy to hear that you enjoyed your conference and the catering we provided. Our staff is always more than happy to tailor the cuisine to any dietary needs. The views of the Cook Inlet are always spectacular and Sweet Chalet has wonderful chocolates. We look forward to hosting your fun weekend trip!

Louisa, Concierge

data.title: Still the best hotel in Anchorage
data.text: My office travel agent has booked me into almost all the major Anchorage hotels, and none of them compare to the Captain Cook.  It is not a cookie-cutter place; the architecture, rooms, murals, restaurants and shops are all originals--you won't find anything like the Cook anywhere else.  My room was spacious, the staff at the front desk was accommodating (late check out) and the service at the breakfast place and pub-restaurant was friendly and quick.  The only place to stay in Anchorage.

owner_response.text:

Thank you for staying with us at the Captain Cook. We appreciate the time you took to provide us with feedback. We're so happy to hear that you enjoyed our unique accommodations and helpful staff. As a frequent visitor to Anchorage, your review means so much to us. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great hotel, concierge is outstanding! Bravo Louisa!
data.text:
Best thing about this hotel is Louisa at the Concierge desk!  This was a last minute trip, we did very little preparation before we arrived.  Louisa was able to book us on several guided tours, reservations at an amazing restaurant that has vegetarian and gf options (go to the Glacier Brew House!), rented us a car to go to the zoo and northern lights--all within 30 min of us arriving!  Highly recommend the All-inOne 5 hour tour from 907 Tours (Susan is the best!)

The lobby is nice, and has an "Alaskan" feel.  We're typically loyal to IHG or Hilton brands, but this is a great 'local feel' hotel.  Several restaurants open for Breakfast, lunch and dinner, many shops in the lobby as well as art galleries; we did most of our souvenir shopping right in the lobby stores; typical Alaskan souvenirs that you'd want, plus a great chocolate shop (Rated Best Dessert in Alaska)
Great Wifi-breakfast not included

Cubby coffee shop is a quick serve breakfast place, long line in the morning, but easy to get a coffee/muffin/fruit to go!

There is a pool, as well as a Womens /Mens lounge -they have separate work-out areas, however the pool is co-ed with nice showers, and places to get ready

Catching a cab is very quick w/their bellhop, and all of the tours will pick up at this hotel.
Rooms are clean (maybe need a little update) but the views from high up are gorgeous.  We watched the sunrise over mountains every morning, and planes take off-view was much more than expected.  Room was big enough to add a rollaway bed for our daughter (we had a King room)
Toiletries in room are decent
Coffee maker in room & mini fridge
Very little drawer space to unpack, but not a big deal

You can rent a car easily and inexpensively from the hotel-concierge will call you a shuttle that will pick up right from the hotel.

There was a conference in the lobby while we were there, chiropractor vendors etc... The hotel is large enough that it didn't bother us. Many additional conference rooms downstairs.

I would recommend for Business or Family trip
Definitely would go back, just for Louisa!  She is absolutely one of the best in the business.  The hotel should do whatever they can to hold on to her!!!

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Hotel Captain Cook, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear BlueJupiterDiana,

Thank you for staying with us at the Hotel Captain Cook. I appreciate the time you took to give such a lovely review. I'm so glad that your last minute trip turned into a great Alaskan adventure. Many visitors during the fall and winter are not aware that there are still great tours and excursions from right here in Anchorage--and pleasant weather too! We're happy to hear that you enjoyed the accommodations and all the amenities we offer. It was my pleasure to serve your family during your stay and I hope to see you again someday in Anchorage!

Louisa, Concierge

Fun Fact: Dog mushing is Alaska's official state sport.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: They Aim to Please
data.text:
The people of Alaska are friendly and helpful, and that extends to the employees of the Captain Cook Hotel.  Our room was large and the beds very comfy.

After a day of hiking, I didn’t want to go out to eat.  Even though hotel restaurants in the U.S. aren’t known for great dining, we went to Fletcher’s.  What a surprise.  I’ve reviewed it plus the Crows Nest under restaurants for more details.  The shops are beautiful with unique items.  If you’re looking for stylish, good quality clothing, there is a great ladies shop with accessories & fashions from the Canadian designer, Joseph Ribhoff.   North of the hotel at the corner of 5th and K Streets is a 7/11-like convenience store where you can get bottled water, snacks, protein bars, etc.

There were some minor things such as the low lighting in the shower.  It’s too dark.  Most hotels with the Keurig coffee machines leave 2 pods each for caffeinated and decaffeinated so we asked at the front desk in the evening if they would deliver more.  It never came.  However, when I called and explained, they were right there.  There was only 1 bathrobe in the room.  For some reason, the maid took it probably to wash and never replaced.  Again, I called and like lightening, 2 were delivered.  We called for help with the luggage, and they were right there.

I definitely would stay here again.

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Hotel Captain Cook, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Chgotourist,

Thank you for staying with us at the Hotel Captain Cook. We appreciate the time you took to provide such detailed feedback about your stay. We're glad you were able to dine at Fletcher's and the Crow's Nest. Our restaurants are held to the same fine standard as our accommodations, so it's great to hear that you enjoyed them. Our staff strives to deliver fast and friendly service for anything our guests need. Thank you for recommending us to future guests and we look forward to hosting you again!

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Hotel
data.text: Iconic landmark, well worth the stay. Comfortable, large rooms with nice amenities.  Perfect location to take in downtown sites, most within walking distance.  Fletchers bar is a wonderful spot for drinks and food.  A locals hang-out.   Not cheap but well worth the price

Fun Fact:  Alaska is the widest state in the United States. When a scale map of Alaska is superimposed on a map of the 48 lower states, Alaska extends from coast to coast.

data.title: Great Ambiance, great restraints, very comfortable
data.text: I stay at a lot of hotels, and many fall into the category of just being basically the same concrete box, nice, but nothing special. This hotel is special. You can tell the second you walk in. The ship theme through is very well done. The historical artifacts, paintings, other artwork, and accompanying stories and explanations are phenomenal. You could walk the hotel for an hour looking at and reading things and completely lose track of time. Very comfortable room, and oh my gosh the shower head! I hate weak shower heads in hotels. This was a dream. I loved the Fletcher's restaurant too!

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Hotel Captain Cook, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear David K,

Thank you for staying at the Hotel Captain Cook. We appreciate you taking the time to let others know what you love about our accommodations. It is our goal to stand out as a place where visitors can experience Alaska in comfort and style. We're happy to hear that you enjoyed our historic ambience and dining in Fletcher's as well. We wish you many happy returns to Anchorage!

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lovely Hotel
data.text: I stayed here with my Husband for 3 nights prior to our Cruise.  It was booked through Princess Cruises and I couldn't have been more happy.  Check in was a breeze and the staff very helpful.  There are several restaurants in this hotel and we ate at Fletchers the first night.  After having to line up for about 15 minutes (bookings really are needed) we were not disappointed with the service or food.  The hotel is near everything you could need and the beds were comfortable after our long days out and about.  There are several shops in the hotel should you not wish to wander outside, or, if you are only here for the night and need to pick up that little souvenir for family and friends back home. My only complaint was the shower pressure.  I had to turn my back to the water flow it was so hard and there was no way of turning it down.  We travelled with friends and they had the same problem in their shower.  Other than that I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel and would definitely stay here if ever in Anchorage again.

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Hotel Captain Cook, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Sue H,

Thank you for staying with us at the Hotel Captain Cook. We appreciate you providing this review for our future guests. We're glad that you enjoyed the accommodations and that you would recommend us to others. Fletcher's is always a great spot for lunch or dinner--you can't beat the pizza! We hope that you'll make it back to Anchorage again soon.

Louisa, Concierge

Fun Fact: Denali, the name for the highest peak in Alaska, means "The Great One."
